alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 12 at 5:19PM CST until January 12 at 5:45PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Northern Early County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 645 PM EST/545 PM CST/. * At 619 PM EST/519 PM CST/, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Blakely, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Blakely around 625 PM EST. Arlington around 640 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Colomokee, Early Co A/p, Douglasville, Rowena and Kolomoki Mounds Sp. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
